Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description REQ-1992 Data Strategy Intern 2026 - Winter W26 Data Strategy Intern 175101B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that's not all. Whether we're leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada. Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you. The Data Strategy and Delivery team is part of the broader Data & Analytics (D&A) function. This team works closely with various departments, including marketing, IT, and customer service, to deliver data-driven insights and data products. The team is made up of several functions and squads that collaborate to manage data as an asset, enable business self-service, and facilitate a data- driven culture. An intern in the Data Strategy and Delivery team would have a dynamic and engaging role, contributing to various data-driven projects and initiatives. Here are some key responsibilities and tasks that an intern might undertake You'll be responsible for: • Contributing to data projects by collaborating with internal data and analytics consumers to deliver end-to-end data-related projects (includes understanding project requirements, analyzing data, and providing actionable insights) • Developing data projects by supporting the development of reusable data products and services by operationalizing insights on the cloud data platform (includes building and deploying internal tools to solve problems or improve processes. • Performing collaborative research by engaging in collaborative research efforts, providing deliverables such as research insights, data assets, and visualizations to help end-users develop a better understanding of various topics. • Generating new ideas, challenging the status quo, taking risks, supporting change, encouraging innovation, and solving problems creatively • Managing deliverables and timelines for own deliverables, negotiating with internal stakeholders to meet relevant project milestones • Support and Contribute to Data Strategic planning and the development of roadmaps for functional areas. • Support Squad leaders in understanding business needs and defining scope and requirements • Support the implementation of pilots in the Data analytics and innovation space Workstyle: Hybrid (3 days on-site) Location: Toronto Term: January - April 2026 Duration: Monday - Friday Interac requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks: • Canadian criminal record check; • Public safety verification; • Canadian ID cross-check; • 5-year employment verification; • Education verification; and If applicable, Credit Inquiry and Social Media Check • How we work We know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with: Connection: You're surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal. Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do. Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks. Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you Please be aware of certain individuals fraudulently using Interac Corp.'s name and logo to offer fictitious employment opportunities. Interac Corp. will never ask, solicit, nor accept any monies in exchange for employment opportunities. Any such offers of employment are fraudulent and invalid, and you are strongly advised to exercise great caution and disregard such offers and invitations. Please note that under no circumstances shall Interac Corp. be held liable or responsible for any claims, losses, damages, expenses, or other inconveniences resulting from or in any way connected to the actions of individuals performing such fraud. Further, such fraudulent communication shall not be treated as any kind of offer or representation by Interac Corp. or its subsidiaries and affiliates. Job Requirements You bring: • You are currently enrolled in a university or college program in a relevant discipline, like computer science, cybersecurity, risk management or IT • Proven experience in data analysis, project management and/or business analyst • Understanding of cloud infrastructure and data management technologies • Strong collaborative skills to work effectively with fraud teams and other stakeholders. • Experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and feature development within relevant industrie • Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation and analysis • Strong collaborative skills to work effectively with other teams and other stakeholders • You have excellent communication skills to convey complex data insights and visualizations clearly • Have strong attention to detail to improve analysis and data accuracy • Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: Understanding of the payments/banking industry • N/A Citizenship Requirement APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://interac.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Interac/job/Toronto/Data-Strategy-Intern_REQ-1992?source=LinkedIn Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
